Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient but not really 4*”
Reviews.Author: Khattab_Towers
Reviews.Content: positives: spacious and comfortable rooms, very convenient for metro and business district. excellent breakfast buffet. negatives: a little tired in places. gym was closed during my stay and no alternative was offered. wifi pretty slow, ok for emails but not much else. tv was chaotic with no guide to channels and what seemed to be the same 7 or 8 stations in random order across the channels. no English language channels. a few mediocre bars nearby but nothing of interest in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dirk V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights for a short business trip. The hotel is nice, with spacious rooms, good desk to do some work, free WIFI, decent breakfast,... There were quite some extras in the hotel room (tooth brush,...), which proved very handy as my luggage was one day late... The metro was right next door. Service was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in the area”
Reviews.Author: procopeo
Reviews.Content: This is hote is by far the best option in this area. There some others good 4 and 5 stars hotel in the area but this is undoubtedly the best hotel with very goods prices if travelling on weekends ( this is a bussines are so rooms are more expensive on weekdays ). It is 100 m. from the Metro station Puerta de Castilla, a great transport hub in Madrid, with quick links to the airport ( 20 minutes ) and to the most historical part of Madrid ( 15 minutes ). We use this hotel on a stopover before a long haul flight because of its great and easy transport connections, but if you´re visiting historical places you may prefer some hotel in the real historic center. The rooms are great: modern, ultraclean and with the ammenities you expect from top hotels. There is also a free wi-fi and for short Internet checkings ( browse the mail, ... ) if you don´t have a computer you can ask the recepcionist and he will kindly let you check Internet in one of te reecption computers. On the overall I pleasant and surprisingly good experience. I have already repeated in this hotel and again will do it in the future. A good and solid choice for short stays in the Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Uninspired”
Reviews.Author: Kukusik
Reviews.Content: Lacking in imagination or originality, this hotel gave me creeps - maybe it's the cold welcome (literally) - when I arrived ALL the windows in my room were open, and that's in 12 degrees weather, or very dark rooms, or lack of luck in reaching the front desk from my room, because they wouldn't pick up the phone (ever!). The location is great, the rooms were spacious, and breakfast was good. That being said, this hotel lacks charm, personality, and service. I stayed there for a week while on business.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you're an iPhone or Mac User”
Reviews.Author: SunriseDoc
Reviews.Content: We were allowed an early check-in and, after some parking confusion (don't park in the lot with the hotel's name unless only to unload luggage - the people at the front desk will tell you a cheaper place), we checked into our spacious and well-appointed, quiet room. The best part was the close proximity to the user-friendly Metro. Though the front desk people were most helpful, it took a visit to the front desk and a lengthy call to their computer server to get us online. We liked this hotel but decided not to use any more Silken Hotels on the rest of our trip because of this hassle. Why can't a so-called business hotel have easier computer access?

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: + Very friendly staff, excellent breakfast with a large choice, comfortable rooms - Hotel bar is not very cosy

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sydney18Perth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opposite to the main train line from Airport to town. However, pick pockets are a problem while on the train - so be wary. Taxis are expensive as anywhere else in cities. It is better to know some Spanish bcos I found communication with the reception difficult, and I needed to sign or use visual aids. The room is comfortable but pricey. The television programmes are all in Spanish with no English subtitles. There are some average sized shopping malls (not many varieties) within walking distance of 30 to 45minutes from the hotel. Otherwise, take a train to the city central for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water and no help from staff!”
Reviews.Author: JLasCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed at the Silken Puerta Castilla last week. The hotel was clean and modern and the rooms were nice. We were pleased on arrival and the price was good. However, on our first morning, there was no hot water to shower, wash hands or anything. We made several calls and we were told that they were fixing the problem. We were able to take luke-warm showers in the evening and were promised the issue was fixed. The next morning, same problem--no hot water. We found out the entire hotel had the same issue. The staff offered no resolution and even "lost" our first reclamation paperwork, so we filled out a second. The entire experience was very frustrating. The location is very close to the metro and only two bus stops from the Real Madrid stadium and the nuevos ministerios area which is very nice. However, don't plan on getting a decent shower if you stay. I do have to thank the cleaning staff though. I left a bag in the room and checked out. When I realized it, I ran back to the room and the cleaning staff had my bag clearly marked with room number and date they found it. Very honest.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, well connected, good public parking, but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Tropos
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms are not very big, so try to get the bigger ones. I got in compensation, after two tries in rooms that that were not done in spite the system showed that they were ready, a top floor room on one of the corners. That was a very nice and big room with a very good king bed, and a nice bathroom. Two problems with the bathroom, first one, it was quite difficult to regulate water temperature (kept changing, not only in my room but also in a business partner in spite one other partner had no problem) and second, a faint sewage smell. We had rented a car and there is a public underground parking connected with the hotel, with quite good rates for periods of days, and a very expensive rate for a day stay. This parking is a good advantage if you travel by car. Very well connected with the Metro system as the station is only meters away from entrance, as well as a multibus station in front of the hotel. Has a restaurant also. Cannot discuss the rate, as it was a corporate one, which was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Madrid visit”
Reviews.Author: rpcj
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel for a visit to Madrid. Either leisure or business it suits both. The hotel is very close to a big metrostation that brings you real quick to the city center. The rooms are big and comfy, beds are clean and the large pillows guarantees a good night sleep. Breakfast is good and buffet style, but is an addition to the standard price. All together: go there and you'll be not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “20 sec to the metro”
Reviews.Author: La P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 20 seconds to the metro! Direct line to the city centre, very convenient. The room was spacious and comfortable. I got a super hot rate on booking.com during their flash sale, it was non-refundable, but almost 70 percent cheaper than usual. The hotel is modern and well-equipped. But be sure to remember which metro exit it is, because it's very complicated to cross the road (there's a huge square with crazy traffic), or you'll have to go down to the underground again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: indianguy
Reviews.Content: This is a business type hotel quite near the city centre (10 minutes on the metro). It was clean and well maintained. There were many restaurants nearby. The problems were: (1) Check-in took half an hour; and (2) for parking one's car one has to enter the parking below, get the entry ticket, bring that to the hotel reception for signing and stamping, take that back to the parking attendant, get a new ticket for the duration of your stay. This takes at least half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: akis a
Reviews.Content: comfortable room,near to metro station, located in a very beautiful square!Room also very comfortable!value for money

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Simon S
Reviews.Content: The service is very professional, the rooms are a bit outdated for four star expectations but the location to a major metro station works in its favor. Overall a pleasant experience although will probably opt for an improved looking four star. It's also close to a few cafeterias and has a McDonald's, burger king and convenience store located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “More suited for business”
Reviews.Author: m20o
Reviews.Content: This is a typical business-style hotel with good, clean and spacious rooms. Placed at one of the corners of Plaza della Castilla, it can be easily reached from the airport both by metro and taxi. They charge an extra of 20€ for breakfast but, at least on working days, there is a nice place, Delina's, just aside the hotel for it. Wifi is free. Due to its position and excellent connections, it's a very convenient location for visiting Madrid, especially if you grab some offers from internet; people that are low on budget or that are looking something more "charming" may want look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel - Metro Convenient for Vacation Stay”
Reviews.Author: mary7484
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the business district, which makes it great for a business traveler, but it is also right on the metro which makes it great for Vacation travelers! The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff spoke English, and free wifi! There weren't a lot of restaurants around, but there is a McDonalds and some small delis around the corner. Overall its a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “old hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling006
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night for business purposes. location is good, metro just next to the hotel to go to the city centre. Staff very unfriendly, no smiles and not very welcoming when arriving. the rooms are OK, but not of a fourstar hotel - more of an "old 4 star". bathroom is also old - with neon bright kind of lights which are not very nice.rooms are also very standard and not hip,modern or cosy. free wifi in the rooms. breakfast was very good! huge amount of choice of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: MartinH1
Reviews.Content: On arrival, the receptionist told me that my room (pre paid via lastminute.com) had been cancelled, and offered to make a new booking. Receptionist didnt offer to call lastminute, he just wanted to make another booking at a higher rate and would not provide me with any proof that my original booking was cancelled, to enable me to get a refund. I called lastminute myself, who sorted it out in about 10 mins. Would it have killed the receptionist to make the call himself?? If he doesnt want to give customer service, why choose to work in a Hotel?? Really bizarre. When my booking was reinstated, I had to get a twin room if I wanted non-smoking. After being messed around so much, could they really not have found me the room type that I had booked?? Ground floor restaurant showing hard pornography on TV over dinner, is this normal in Spanish hotels? Bedrooms of a really good standard, breakfast good also but the experience tarnished by a terrible welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: arieltk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, very good breakfast, free wifi in the rooms and helpful personel. The Plaza Castilla aerea is not so nice, but the metro is just a few steps away. I would recommend it specially for Business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Tourist Hotel but would come again”
Reviews.Author: Dennis49
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the name outside is ´"Hotel Puerta Castilla" so dont´look for Silken. It´s a business man´s hotel being in the Commercial Centre right next to a Bank. So dont expect swimming pool, sauna or gym. The rooms are large with TV, AC and a good sized bathrooms. We were on the 11th floor. Breakfast is charged extra and isn´t worth the money. After the first day we ate next door outside at a choice of MacDonalds and two other cafes. We paid about 12 Euros for a basic breakfast for 3 rather than 22 Euros each at the Hotel. The hotel is right on the Metro Line number 1 at the station "Plaza de Castilla". Buy a 4 day pass at the station and use that, Ticket machines are in several selectable languages and take credit cards and cash. The journey into central madrid takes 20 minutes on the Metro. I´d come back again, but for no longer than 4 nights. The reception staff a rather glum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Madrd”
Reviews.Author: melemelon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the slack time in August. We had prepaid for our visit through a special on Orbitz that included breakfast which was terrific as buffet breakfasts in Spanish hotels are very pricey. We had booked a standard room but after I requested a "quiet room" we were given a jr. suite at the end of the floor. There was a spacious bath, a sitting room & a very large bedroom with a king bed. And it was quiet, we never saw or heard another person during our entire stay even though there were some large international youth groups staying in the hotel. We really appreciated the terrific air-conditioning which has been a problem in other Spanish hotels. We developed a leak from one of the vents on the second day of a 4 day visit and were immediately transferred to the equivalent room on a higher floor. I suspect this is primarily a business hotel because of its location on Paseo Castellano in the heart of the business district. We picked it because of the location of my daughter's apartment in Las Tablas in the north of Madrid. It is far from the tourist attractions in central Madrid, but the metro stop is next to the hotel and a major city bus stop is across the street. The hotel staff told us about the #27 bus that goes all the way down the Paseo to the museum district (the Prado, the Thyssen, Retiro Park, etc) and we used it several times. The buses take the Metro 10 ticket, which makes using them easy and saves on the fares. If you are dying for American food, there is a McDonalds in the same building. We only indulged in a "large" (not by American standards) coke - very expensive at close to 4 euros- just to get ice in a cup! Our only problem was with the unreliable computer connections. WiFi access to the internet is offered throughout the hotel at no charge. We payed 7euros for 24 access to a more complete connection to use a home computer reliably, but the signal dropped constantly. We think the very old laptop was dying so that may have been the problem, not the hotel. So if you don't need to be in the middle of the tourist action this hotel is a good choice. Especially if you can get the economical rates - 120 euro/night including full breakfast - that we got.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: monica061
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silken Hotel Puerta Castilla in Madrid last week and I have to say I was disappointed by a number of issues. 1) The water was being treated with cleaning chemicals and we couldn't use it that afternoon. What was concerning is that no one informed us when we checked in, there was a small sign in the elevator and personnel entered our room twice when we were in it! We were on our honeymoon! No apologies either! 2) We were very disappointed with the front desk service as well. When we asked basic questions about 1)how to get to the airport, we got varying answers 2) when we asked about good restaurants in the area, we got the answer that we could be given names of restaurants but no one could tell if they were good or bad--isn't that the job of a hotel front desk? Last but not least, when we checked out we ended up taking a cab to the airport. We had asked for one to come at 8am, the hotel called one and then we got charged for the distance the cab traveled to the hotel and the few minutes it waited. It seems it would have made sense for the front desk to tell us (since we are visitors) to hail a cab outside to avoid this huge fee. I do believe a hotel front desk has a minimal obligation to look out for its guests and of all the hotel we stayed at in Spain, this was the only one that did not. Overall, we were extremely disapppointed in the customer service at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, amazing and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RaiMartin
Reviews.Content: Great location, amazing rooms, great services, as room service, spa, sauna. Everything just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: John_Evans1951
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a short two day tourist trip to Madrid. We think we got good value for money at this hotel. The room was very clean and staff was friendly. We got a great view over the square from the 11th floor. The hotel is located 5m from the metro, where 3 lines intersect, easy to get anywhere quickly. The centre is about 10-15mins by tube, Bernabeu only two stops away, and the airport also only 20mins by metro. There is a McD next toor, a Rodilla sandwich bar 2 doors down and an inexpensive and vibrant clothings market on Sunday morning. Be informed that there is no gym/pool/spa etc. So - if what you want is a value for money, clean place without all the unnecessary extras is what you want, we recommend this hotel. It fully served its purpose for us.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to see the city”
Reviews.Author: dmath35489
Reviews.Content: silken was a great hotel for madrid. it was very convinient. 3 metro lines stop a couple of steps from the hotel. we took our luggage from the airport and it was easy. checked in at 12. very clean and professional. and the metro take u to atocha station without switching (easy for our luggage). great hotel, worth the slighly higher than average cost. and mcdonalds next door closes at 2 am, another cafe next to that

Reviews.Title: “I was robbed and mistreated at the hotel! I'll never go back!”
Reviews.Author: AmaliaH
Reviews.Content: Someone stoled my hat at hotel. That was the only thing I left outside the safe and my looked lugagge. I talked to the staff and the hotel manager at the same day and they did nothing. They said they asked the person responsible for cleaning the room and that she didn't find it anywhere, which was pretty obvious she wouldn't since I had left it in the room and it wasn't there anymore. I complained with the manager and he was very rude and even yelled at me by the phone saying there was nothing he could about it eventhough there was a camera 3 meters away from my bedroom door and they could find out who entered in the room. For me the main problem was that they didn't take any responsability for the fact and didn't seem to care that there is a person in their staff who steals from their clients.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Madrid!!!”
Reviews.Author: charthillscotties
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at this great hotel! Not only were the beds great, the rooms comfortable and clean, but the location right in front of the Metro Plaza Castilla made this the number one hotel for us in Madrid! We had a great view of the Plaza. For Americans needing a "food fix" there is a McDonalds in the next building. The hotel is quiet, air conditioning works great, big modern bathroom, hotel staff very friendly and helpful,internet always a great connection and the best part is that it doesn't cost an arm and a leg to stay there in comparison to others of its type in the city. Didn't try the restaurant, but it looks really nice. I will return there every time I go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheHitman69
Reviews.Content: Visited the Silken Puerta Castilla in mid February 2011 and found it to be a great hotel to use as a base for a sightseeing trip to Madrid. Located at the Plaza De Castilla it is ideally place as metro lines 1, 9 and 10 run through the metro station the entry to which stands about 20-25 metres from the hotel entrance. This makes it very easy to get to from the airport and means you can get anywhere in the city very quickly. It is only 2 metro stops (or a 20 minute walk) from the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium which suited our needs as part of the reason for the trip was to watch Real Madrid play. I found the staff very friendly and helpful to the point that they even helped my 14 year old son with his Spanish as he had an exam to sit when he returned from this trip. Due to it beening located near a major roundabout and a bus station there is some traffic noise but none of my group of 7 were kept awake by the traffic. The hotel is on the north side of the plaza behind the Tower of Europe 1 which in itself is worth seeing and around the plaza and the immediate area there are plenty of bars and restraunts including McDonalds and Burger King if you are not a tapas fan. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and of a good size with all the facilities you would expect although the WIFI was a little difficult to connect to but that was easily solved by going for a coffee in McDonalds next door and using theirs. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid especially for sightseeing as its possition next to a major metro station means travel around the city in very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BigLou60
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights last September 2010 and had a wonderful time. Rooms are comfy, locations just right, staff friendly and helpful, and the price was right. The best part is the proximity to the public transportation. Bus and metro hub gets us anywhere in the city. We only spent the cost of a metro ride to airport. After a hard day of experiencing bustling Madrid, it was so refreshing to get back to the hotel for another round. We’d stay again when in Madrid for sure.

Reviews.Title: “4*, mmm”
Reviews.Author: PhilVon
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, business facilities are average to good, food in the hotel is good and the staff pleasant and helpful. The rooms are relatively basic for a 4 star and need upgrading a little in my opinion to reach 4 star standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valevalencia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a room facing the inside courtyard. Nice and quiet though a little noise from the corridor. The rooms being on the larger side was better than just basic but not amazing, however tastely furnished. Service was adequate, neither rude nor overly comforting. Location was perfect seconds from the metro which you will need if you want to get into madrid. appx 10mins. All in all a very good value 4 star business hotel even if it's just for a relaxing weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: ulukai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with colleagues on a business trip. location is good, a busy roundabout, metros, buses, etc. My advice - don't sleep with windows open. Hotel rooms are basic, i.e. clean, not so big, with all facilities you expect. Beds ok. Went to the gym couple of times, it has a funny layout, and can be cramped if there are more than 2-3 people. Fortunately most of the time I was alone. Breakfast was very good, and for dinner we always went out - great bars & restaurants in this area. First night was very late so ordered room service - it was good & very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JVa70
Reviews.Content: Good - subway station 50m - spacious room (because it was the last on the corridor) - breakfast Bad - a bit worn - nothing to do in the neighborhood (but remember the metro station)

Reviews.Title: “Can be a good choice in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Harrys_Was_There
Reviews.Content: I was surprised from the good quality of the room: plenty of space, excellent facilities and extras. Breakfast is also nice. It is quite far from the city centre (15min by taxi), although there is often transportation. Staff speaks English, which is not so common in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: anothersuitcase
Reviews.Content: Not too much to say about this place, average size rooms, average service, all pretty average. A bit out from the city centre but metro looks very close. Good for Real Madrids stadium only 15min walk away

Reviews.Title: “Wach out for your stuff in Silken Puerta de Castilla!/Cuidado con vuetras perten”
Reviews.Author: i_ivanovabg
Reviews.Content: Wach out in Silken Puerta de Castilla! At first see it looks like a regular 4* hotel-the location is kind of far away from everything but somehow with the transportation in madrid you can relatively easy get to the center.The problem of this hotel is the personal!Don't forget anything there because there is now way to get it back-watches, telefons or some kind of jewell the personal doesn't care that you may want it back. The reason that you are forigner gives them the sensation that you probably won't be able to return asking for your stuff. If you dear to call more than 2 times there won't be anybody answering you even at receotion because they see that you are calling from abroad. So your stay there may cost you much more that you have planned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucian_angel
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Madrid Barajas Airport just after 8pm, took the metro to Plaza de Castillia which was very easy to find. When I exited the metro I was confronted with the most fabulous sight, Madrid's very own ultramodern twin version of the leaning tower of Pisa, this pair of highly controversial gravity-defying torres. At night what a breathtaking view - everything looked clean, fresh and big! On entering the hotel we were greeted by warm smiles from reception. Checking in was painless, I asked for a room with a view because I wanted to see more of those beautiful towers. My room was on the 7th floor, a corner suite. On entering I was in heaven. Will I leave the hotel room - very hard decision now... The place was immaculate. The bathroom was a great size with a lovely view too, there was a living area with a tv, and two 2-seater sofas and a centre table, the bedroom was to die for so large with large twin beds, flat screen tv, trouser press, chairs, tables, desks and 2 walls of floor to ceiling windows. What a view! It was breathtaking, I slept with the curtains open. The staff were friendly and accomodating, tried some nice cocktails and felt very much at home. I was lucky to get a special price that weekend. I definately need to go back for at least a week as there was too much to see and do in one weekend. If you like the easy laid back life and architecture - then madrid is your place. The glass hotel itself is a work of art.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Only if You Have To Because of Location”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: Lets get real with these reviews. First it is across the street from the major bus station. Second it is built on top of a Mcdonalds. Third it is in the midst of low quality office blocks and rebuilt public housing. Fourth it is a very long ways from anything other than business. You Have To Stay Here because traffic is tough in the morning is its only redeaming virtue. The hotel is cheaply made. Every door in every room on the floor above below and yours slams and you hear it all night. No exceptions. The rooms are nice it is a modern hotel built for the business traveler and yet the Internet is $25 a day $10 for 1 hour. No free internet in the lobby but there is almost no place to sit in the lobby. You can not walk to anywhere unless you want to catch a bus to another city. There are no restaurants around except a Mcdonalds, a bad chinese and a few bars. The restaurant wreaks of smoke and the average entree is $30+. A meal with a salad and a glass of wine runs to $70 and is mediocre. This is a badly made business hotel in a bad location which gets by because like me you have to be in the north part of town for business. If you can stay closer to the city get up a little earlier and take a taxi. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: bridalwedge
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid on a girls weekend, we all thought that the hotel was situated in the centre of things, as was stated on their website. However, the hotel is miles away from the city centre, it cost us 20 euros in a taxi to get to the city centre. It does have access to the metro right across from the hotel, but you have to change at different juctions and is not ideal for getting around late at night. Be careful not to get ripped off by taxi drivers from the airport, they charged us 40 euros for the taxi, even though it read 20 euro on his meter. The hotel itself is very nice, and the rooms are very clean, didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. This hotel is not central and is far too far out to enjoy a night out in the city centre, ideal for business though as it is right in the centre of the financial sector.

HotelInfo.Name: Silken Puerta Castilla Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo De La Castellana 191-A, 28046 Madrid, Spain
